It is also the &quot;oldest national park east of the Mississippi River&quot; (Jefferson, 2012, p. 17).&nbsp; Over the course of its history, its name has changed three times: from Sieur de Monts National Park in 1916, to Lafayette National Park in 1919, to Acadia National Park in 1929 (Jefferson, 2012). The park is located in the northern part of Maine near Bar Harbor (Maine Travel Board, 2017).</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_806a9486-8112-0722-bdd8-0f3aaeffacb1\" style=\"width: 200px; height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of Balancing your ideas and your sources, opens in a new tab</span></a><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Your reader needs to know when your ideas begin and end and what words and ideas are borrowed from others.<br /><br />One way you can do this is by using a <strong>signal phrase </strong>such as <em>According to Martinez </em>or <em>As Paula Martinez explains</em> with the date in parentheses after the source&#39;s name.<em>&nbsp; </em>Using a signal phrase is considered citing.&nbsp; It lets the reader know the author of your source.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"For example, you start a paragraph with your own ideas.  At the end of your own ideas, you start the next sentence with the signal phrase As Paula Martinez (2015) explains, and follow this with words and ideas of Paula Martinez that support your points.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /><br />&nbsp;</p><p>If your signal phrase introduces a <strong>direct quotation</strong>, also include the page or paragraph number after the direct quotation and before the period:<br />&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">According to Paula Martinez (2015), &ldquo;For many hikers, Yosemite is the gold standard, but every national park is a hiker&rsquo;s dream&rdquo; <span class=\"marker\">(p. 4)</span>.</span><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"Using signal phrases"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Which signal phrase in this paragraph from your article about hiking indicates that ideas are borrowed from another source?</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Dedicated hikers can easily spend a week hiking the many beautiful trails in Yosemite.&nbsp; However, some hikes are much more strenuous than others, and you need to make sure that you are physically&nbsp;ready for the challenge.&nbsp; Hiking expert Paula Martinez (2016), author of <i>The Hiker&#39;s&nbsp;Guide to&nbsp;Yosemite,</i>&nbsp;suggests, &quot;Before planning any strenuous hikes, visit your doctor to ensure that you are fit enough to handle the rigors of the trail.&nbsp; You should know the distance you will be hiking, and the elevation gain&quot; (p. 52).&nbsp; It is important for hikers to know their own capabilities and limitations.&nbsp; A doctor&#39;s assessment is the safest way to ensure that you are ready for your trip.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_ab9cafe0-edc9-1d46-315c-828295ee2e87\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_ab9c...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>If you do not choose to use a signal phrase, you include a citation with the author&#39;s name at the end of the direct quotation, paraphrase, or summary:</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">. . .For example, &ldquo;beginners should start with the Bridalveil Fall Trail and Lower Yosemite Fall Trail, both of which are considered easy&rdquo; <span class=\"marker\">(Martinez, 2016, p. 54)</span>.&nbsp;</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Is it better to cite your source using the&nbsp;author&#39;s name in a signal phrase or with an in-text citation?&nbsp;<br /><br />The choice is yours.<br /><br />Good writers vary their style to keep readers&#39; interest.&nbsp; Try reading your work aloud and experimenting with both ways of acknowledging the author or source.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>If you use many pieces of information from the same source within one paragraph, acknowledge the source <strong>each time</strong> you include a direct quotation, paraphrase, or summary in the paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Citing the same source more than once in a paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph from your article about hiking in the national parks includes information that comes from a website article by Lydia Tan that was published on March 10, 2017.<br /><br />It includes two paraphrases and a direct quotation, all from Tan&#39;s article.&nbsp; Indicate whether each sentence requires a citation.</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p style=\"line-height:250%;\">Visiting a national park can be costly and it is easy to overlook some of your expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp; During peak season, park entrance fees can be as much as $30 per vehicle or even more<span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_cb82eb19-8e0f-62fd-54fb-7c5848545845\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_cb82...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">. </span>Getting to and from the park usually involves a long trip of some sort, with the cost of airplane fares and rental cars, or the cost of gasoline and wear and tear on your own car<span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_2fecac01-0d2a-4896-dda8-3d8205e5d95a\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_2fec...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">. </span>Many hotels in national parks &ldquo;know that travelers to the national parks have few hotel choices, so they charge a premium fee&rdquo;<span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_b4b96fbf-722a-400f-ddfc-3eff63213f82\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_b4b9...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">.&nbsp; </span>From my own experience, I know that other costs, including food and the equipment necessary to keep you safe and sheltered from the weather, add up quickly<span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> </span><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_f33eb6b3-9364-5c88-6bc2-72ed1f310a8e\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_f33e...</strong></jumc><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>You can use a signal phrase to acknowledge a source each time you use it.<br /><br />If you use a signal phrase more than once, then you only need to include the date in parentheses the first time you mention the source.</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>In this paragraph, you use two ideas by Stephen Jefferson.&nbsp; Choose the best signal phrase to introduce each idea.</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p style=\"line-height:250%;\">If you are going to visit only one part of Acadia, then I recommend Cadillac Mountain.&nbsp; However, you&#39;ll need to get there before sunrise.&nbsp; What makes Cadillac Mountain so special?&nbsp; There, according to Stephen Jefferson <jumc ju-mc=\"mc_b61698c3-65e0-6387-15fa-cb53f35b8eb7\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_b616...</strong></jumc>, &quot;you can see the sun rise earlier than you can at any other place within the United States&quot; (p. 18).&nbsp; <jumc ju-mc=\"mc_a20ffeb8-52a6-2bad-7b21-672e5ac7d202\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_a20f...</strong></jumc><span> </span>also points out that you shouldn&#39;t expect to watch the sunrise all alone on Cadillac Mountain, because dozens of other hikers will probably have arrived there before you do.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph includes one direct quotation and two paraphrases, all from Paula Martinez&#39;s book.&nbsp; Each one is cited:<br />&nbsp;</p><ul style=\"padding-left:15px;\"><li>The first paraphrase is introduced by a signal phrase: According to<span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"> Martinez (2016). . .</span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">&nbsp;</span> This signal phrase tells readers the source of the paraphrase.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>The direct quotation in the sentence that begins <span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">For example . . .</span> is not introduced by a signal phrase.&nbsp; It has a citation at the end that includes the author&#39;s last name, the date, and the page number.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>The same is true of the paraphrase that begins <span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">In contrast, Snow Creek Trail. . .</span> &nbsp; It is not introduced by a signal phrase, so it has a citation at the end that includes the author&#39;s last name and the date.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Knowing your capabilities makes it easy to find a trail that is both safe and fun for you.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">According to Martinez (2016)</span>, there are many options at each skill level.&nbsp; For example, &ldquo;beginners should start with the Bridalveil Fall Trail and Lower Yosemite Fall Trail, both of which are considered easy&rdquo; <span class=\"marker\">(Martinez, 2016, p. 54)</span>.&nbsp; I have hiked both trails and they are very accessible.&nbsp; In contrast, Snow Creek Trail and Half Dome Trail are both strenuous; neither should be attempted unless you have ample hiking experience <span class=\"marker\">(Martinez, 2016)</span>.&nbsp;&nbsp; No matter where you hike, you will see beautiful scenery.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>If you are including information from different authors or sources, then the citation rules apply to each author or source.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Citing different sources within the same paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph from your article about hiking includes information from three different sources.<br />&nbsp;</p><ul style=\"padding-left:15px;\"><li>Terrence Trent wrote an article titled &quot;The Glories of Glacier National Park&quot; for <em>World Traveler</em> magazine.&nbsp; It was published on May 18, 2015.&nbsp; In the article, Trent notes that Chief Mountain is very popular with visitors.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>Stephen Jefferson wrote an article titled &quot;All About Acadia: The Basics&quot; for<em> Journal of Parks and Recreation</em>. The article was published on July 15, 2012.&nbsp; On page 18 of the article Jefferson states &quot;Some of the park&#39;s most popular features are Cadillac Mountain and the Blue Hill Overlook.&quot;<br />&nbsp;</li><li>&nbsp;Lydia Tan wrote a website article published on March 10, 2017, and mentioned some of most well-known hiking destinations in Yosemite National Park.</li></ul><p><br />Add the correct citations to the paragraph:</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p style=\"line-height:250%;\">Geologic formations are an extremely important aspect of the national park experience.&nbsp; Each of these parks is home to mountains and outcroppings that offer beautiful photo opportunities. At Glacier National Park, Chief Mountain is particularly popular <span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\"><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_d32dafca-f0fe-07d5-41d5-e88765a9ea1b\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\"><strong>ID: mc_d32d...</strong></jumc></span>.&nbsp; At Acadia National Park, &ldquo;some of the park&#39;s most popular features are Cadillac Mountain and the Blue Hill Overlook&quot; Using signal phrases<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">&nbsp;,</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><ul><li>Use a signal phrase such as <em>According to Jones (2014)</em> to show where your ideas end and the words or ideas of another begin.</li><li>When you use a signal phrase for a direct quotation, include the page number in parentheses at the end of the quotation.</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width:90%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember! More than one citation in a paragraph<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">&nbsp;,</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><ul><li>When you paraphrase, summarize, or quote a source more than once within a paragraph, acknowledge the source each time you use it with either a signal phrase or a citation in parentheses.</li><li>When you use multiple signal phrases to acknowledge the same source within a paragraph, only include a citation in parentheses with the first signal phrase.&nbsp;This pattern starts over with each new paragraph.</li><li>When you use multiple sources within a paragraph, the same rules apply.&nbsp; Each time you use a piece of information from a source, you must acknowledge it.</li></ul><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" S. national parks: </span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><style type=\"text/css\">p.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 14.0px 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #323333; -webkit-text-stroke: #323333} span.s1 {font-kerning: none}</style>Dedicated hikers can easily spend a week hiking the many beautiful trails in Yosemite. However, some hikes are much more strenuous than others, and you need to make sure that you are physically ready for the challenge. Hiking expert Paula Martinez (2016), author of <em>The Hiker&rsquo;s Guide to Yosemite</em>, suggests, &quot;Before planning any strenuous hikes, visit your doctor to ensure that you are fit enough to handle the rigors of the trail. You should know the distance you will be hiking, and the elevation gain&quot; (p. 52). It is important for hikers to know their own capabilities and limitations. A doctor&rsquo;s assessment is the safest way to ensure that you are ready for your trip.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"}
